Dear Mr. Gage:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 5, 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of ISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of five new hire employee files reviewed did not have an evaluation completed
within 180 days as required. The employee was employed on July 1, 2019 and the
first evaluation was dated for March 16, 2020.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
One of eight employee files reviewed tuberculosis screening was not completed as
required. The employee had a screening completed on October 19, 2018 and not
again until November 1, 2019 exceeding 1-year period from the previous screening.
R 400.4147 Dental Care.
(3) Reexamination shall be provided at least every 14 months
unless greater frequency is indicated.
One of three open resident files reviewed, dental re-examination was not completed
as required. The resident had an exam in March 2019, requiring a follow up
cleaning in six months. The resident has not yet received the dental re-examination.
The agency attempted to schedule an appointment in March 2020 but could not due
to COVID 19.
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of the following:
1

(b) Plans for parent and child visitation.
(g) Projected length of stay and next placement.
One of one initial service plans reviewed lacked documentation of the plans for
visitation, projected length of stay, and next placement as required.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(3) The updated treatment plan shall include all of the following
information:
(a) Dates, persons contacted, type of contact, and place of
contact.
Three of three open resident files reviewed lacked documentation of all the social
work contacts regarding the resident as required. Therapy was not documented to
have occurred in any of the service plans.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
There are no additional ISEP violations.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
MA190000000682 2.10 Services to be Provided
f. Restraint and Seclusion
The Contractor shall report the use of seclusion/isolation and
restraint within 24 hours (or the next business day) of the use of
seclusion/isolation or restraint. The Contract will utilize the
MDHHS Incident Reporting Form in MiSACWIS to record all
incidents of seclusion/isolation and restraint.
In review of the MiSACWIS case record, the facility has not entered physical
restraints into MiSACWIS since opening in January 2019.
MA190000000682 2.10 Services to be Provided
m. Individual or Group Therapy
The contractor shall provide at least weekly direct therapy
services for each child individually and/or in group sessions If
the child is provided with group therapy, then at least one
2

session out of four must be an individual therapy session.
Individual and/or group therapy shall be provided in accordance
with the child’s treatment needs as identified in the child’s
service plan.
In three of three open resident files reviewed, the therapy documentation provided to
not demonstrate residents are seen weekly for direct therapy services.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The facility was provided with technical assistance on completion of updated
service plans including updates being made to each section and all contacts
including therapy be included in the social work contacts.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to the six month Renewal
Inspection. During that review, the only citation was regarding central registry
clearances completion for each staff. This issue was resolved and now the State of
Michigan will be completing these checks initially and annually.
A virtual unannounced tour of the facility was completed on May 22, 2020 due to
COVID 19. During the tour the facility appeared clean, residents were observed to be
in the living room with staff interacting appropriately. A staff member was cleaning the
kitchen. The meal menu was posted. The basement level had ample toys and items
for play. The bedrooms and bathrooms were clean, and bedding was being washed.
DCWL has not received Cost Reports/Financial Audit Reports from the MDHHS
Bureau of Audits. If necessary, once received, an amendment to this report will be
made.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
3

receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
